00058 #ifndef HEADER_HMAC_H
00059 #define HEADER_HMAC_H
00060 
00061 #ifdef OPENSSL_NO_HMAC
00062 #error HMAC is disabled.
00063 #endif
00064 
00065 #include <openssl/evp.h>
00066 
00067 /*  Increased from 64 to 128 inorder to make it
00068     work with SHA2 algos */
00069 #define HMAC_MAX_MD_CBLOCK  128
00070 
00071 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00072 extern "C" {
00073 #endif
00074 
00075 typedef struct hmac_ctx_st
00076     {
00077     const EVP_MD *md;
00078     EVP_MD_CTX md_ctx;
00079     EVP_MD_CTX i_ctx;
00080     EVP_MD_CTX o_ctx;
00081     unsigned int key_length;
00082     unsigned char key[HMAC_MAX_MD_CBLOCK];
00083     } HMAC_CTX;
00084 
00085 #define HMAC_size(e)    (EVP_MD_size((e)->md))
00086 
00087 
00088 void HMAC_CTX_init(HMAC_CTX *ctx);
00089 void HMAC_CTX_cleanup(HMAC_CTX *ctx);
00090 
00091 #define HMAC_cleanup(ctx) HMAC_CTX_cleanup(ctx) /* deprecated */
00092 
00093 void HMAC_Init(HMAC_CTX *ctx, const void *key, int len,
00094            const EVP_MD *md); /* deprecated */
00095 void HMAC_Init_ex(HMAC_CTX *ctx, const void *key, int len,
00096           const EVP_MD *md, ENGINE *impl);
00097 void HMAC_Update(HMAC_CTX *ctx, const unsigned char *data, int len);
00098 void HMAC_Final(HMAC_CTX *ctx, unsigned char *md, unsigned int *len);
00099 unsigned char *HMAC(const EVP_MD *evp_md, const void *key, int key_len,
00100             const unsigned char *d, int n, unsigned char *md,
00101             unsigned int *md_len);
00102 
00103 
00104 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00105 }
00106 #endif
00107 
00108 #endif
